author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of the People’s Welfare Front (PWF) staged a demonstration on Anna Salai on Tuesday protesting against the arrest of Kanhaiya Kumar, president of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) students union on sedition charges and assault on students of the varsity.

Leading the demonstration, R. Viswanathan, secretary of the CPI condemned the illegal detention of students and said the BJP was trying to curtail freedom of expression. The filing of sedition case against the president of JNU students union is objectionable and the case should be withdrawn, he said.

CPI (M) secretary R. Rajangam accused the BJP-led NDA of trying to undermine the secular fabric of the country. The attack on journalists and teachers at the Patiala House courts has exposed the real face of the BJP and how the Government is running the country, he said.
title: PWF members protest against arrest of Kanhaiya
